moduledef.title: Dissolve
moduledef.usage: Dissolves the Agent from the host computer.

paramdef.name: immediate
paramdef.usage: Execute the command immediately without waiting for existing audits to finish.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Deactivate Agent
moduledef.usage: Deactivates the running agent without uninstalling it. No further audits will be possible until the agent is started again.

paramdef.name: immediate
paramdef.usage: Execute the command immediately without waiting for existing audits to finish.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Restart Agent
moduledef.usage: Restarts the agent service.

paramdef.name: immediate
paramdef.usage: Execute the command immediately without waiting for existing audits to finish.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.usage: List of Scheduled tasks (created via the 'at' command or Task Scheduler)

paramdef.name: MD5
paramdef.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA1
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA256

moduledef.warning: Running two ports audits simultaneously may cause both to fail.
moduledef.usage: Active and listening ports and, where available, the process associated with them.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Process Listing (API Mode)
moduledef.usage: Lists running processes as reported by the operating system.

paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Event Logs
moduledef.usage: Acquire complete listings of the operating system event logs. Enumerates and acquires all logs if none are specified.

paramdef.name: eventlog
paramdef.usage:
The eventlog(s) in which to parse (e.g. Application
System
Security)

paramdef.name: eventlogfullpath
paramdef.usage: The full path and filename to the eventlog(s) to parse

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Registry Listing (API Mode)
moduledef.usage: Returns a listing of registry keys using standard API methods

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage: Top-level Registry key to walk from. Path if specified must include the hive name (such as HKLM).

paramdef.name: Path Regex
paramdef.usage:
Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a key or value name must match to be returned.
Examples:
Match any key or value in any sub-key of the root: .*
Match any key or value named Run in any sub-key: .*\\Run
Match any key or value in a sub-key of Services: .*\\Services\\.*
 (note that backslashes must be escaped).

paramdef.name: Value Regex
paramdef.usage:
Return results only for values that contain data matching a Perl Compatible regular expression,
such as "svchost(\d\d)?\.exe".
Note that REG_SZ values are automatically converted from UTF16 to UTF8 for comparison,
all other values are compared "as-is".

paramdef.name: Type
paramdef.usage: Control whether keys and values are returned. Valid values for type are "KeysOnly", "ValuesOnly", or "All". Default is "All".

paramdef.name: Depth
paramdef.usage: Specifies the number of levels to recurse in the tree of keys rooted at root_key. Use -1 to recurse the entire tree. Starting depth is not relative to the hive.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Registry Listing (Raw Mode)
moduledef.usage: Returns a listing of registry keys using Raw methods which may bypass security and access restrictions.

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage: Top-level Registry key to walk from. Path if specified must include the hive name (such as HKLM).

paramdef.name: Path Regex
paramdef.usage:
Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a key or value name must match to be returned.
Examples:
Match any key or value in any sub-key of the root: .*
Match any key or value named Run in any sub-key: .*\\Run
Match any key or value in a sub-key of Services: .*\\Services\\.*
 (note that backslashes must be escaped).

paramdef.name: Value Regex
paramdef.usage:
Return results only for values that contain data matching a Perl Compatible regular expression,
such as "svchost(\d\d)?\.exe".
Note that REG_SZ values are automatically converted from UTF16 to UTF8 for comparison,
all other values are compared "as-is".

paramdef.name: Type
paramdef.usage: Control whether keys and values are returned. Valid values for type are "KeysOnly", "ValuesOnly", or "All". Default is "All".

paramdef.name: Depth
paramdef.usage: Specifies the number of levels to recurse in the tree of keys rooted at root_key. Use -1 to recurse the entire tree. Starting depth is relative to the hive (eg, \HKLM\SOFTWARE).

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Registry Hive Listing
moduledef.usage: Lists registry hives for use in a Registry Listing audit. Includes hives which can only be acquired in Raw mode (such as the SAM hive).

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: File Listing (API Mode)
moduledef.warning: May return more information than expected if 'Get Resources' is selected, it is strongly recommended to only use this parameter when targetting a single file.

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage:
Path where search starts. The trailing back-slash is optional.
Examples: 
C:\
D:\WINDOWS\

paramdef.title: Path Regex
paramdef.name: Regex
paramdef.usage:
Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a file must match to be returned.
You must use standard Regular Expression escaping ( '\\' matches a single '\', '\.' matches '.' )

Examples:
Match all files in any subdirectory: .*
Match .xls files in any subdirectory: .*\.xls
Match .xls files in a subdirectory named Temp: .*\\Temp\\.*\.xls

paramdef.name: Depth
paramdef.usage: Number of directory levels to include, with -1 representing full depth

paramdef.name: MD5
paramdef.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA1
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA256
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: Preserve Times
paramdef.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

paramdef.name: Analyze Entropy
paramdef.usage: Calculate entropy for executable files. High entropy may indicate a packed executable.

paramdef.name: Enumerate Imports
paramdef.usage: Identify modules and functions imported by executable files.

paramdef.name: Enumerate Exports
paramdef.usage: Identify modules and functions exported by executable files.

paramdef.name: Analyze File Anomalies
paramdef.usage: Detect higher-order anomalies which may indicate malicious files.

paramdef.name: Scan Entry Point Distance
paramdef.usage: Specifies the number of bytes from the entry point to scan for jumps.

paramdef.name: Verify Digital Signatures
paramdef.usage: Verify the digital signature on executable files

paramdef.name: Minimum Sizes
paramdef.usage: The minimum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

paramdef.name: Maximum Sizes
paramdef.usage: The maximum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

paramdef.name: Filter MD5
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific MD5 hash

paramdef.name: Filter SHA1
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA1 hash

paramdef.name: Filter SHA256
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA256 hash

paramdef.name: Content Regex
paramdef.usage: Search files for particular content.

paramdef.name: AND Operator
paramdef.usage: A file's content must match all regex parameters.

paramdef.name: Strings
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to parse specified files for strings. If strings is enabled, default string length is 4.

paramdef.name: shortest matched string
paramdef.usage: Minimum Recognized String Length. Default: 4

paramdef.name: Include Files
paramdef.usage: Return file item types.

paramdef.name: Include Directories
paramdef.usage: Return directory item types.

paramdef.name: Get Resources
paramdef.usage: Return resources stored in a PE file.

paramdef.name: Get Resource Data
paramdef.usage: Return all data associated with all resources in a PE file. WARNING: This option can return very large amounts of data even with narrowly-scoped audits. Consider using "Exclude Resource Types" and verifying the size of the results from a single host before running on multiple hosts.

paramdef.name: Get Version Info
paramdef.usage: Return version information stored in a PE file.

paramdef.name: Exclude Resource Types
paramdef.usage: List of resource types to exclude when extracting PE resources.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage:
The absolute path of the directory containing the file to acquire. The trailing back-slash is optional.
Example:
C:\WINDOWS\

paramdef.name: Filename
paramdef.usage:
The name of the file to acquire.
Example: notepad.exe

paramdef.name: Preserve Times
paramdef.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: File Listing (Raw Mode)
moduledef.warning: May return more information than expected if 'Get Resources' is selected, it is strongly recommended to only use this parameter when targetting a single file.

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage:
Path where search starts. The trailing back-slash is optional.
Examples: 
C:\
D:\WINDOWS\

paramdef.title: Path Regex

paramdef.usage:
Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a file must match to be returned.
You must use standard Regular Expression escaping ( '\\' matches a single '\', '\.' matches '.' )

Examples:
Match all files in any subdirectory: .*
Match .xls files in any subdirectory: .*\.xls
Match .xls files in a subdirectory named Temp: .*\\Temp\\.*\.xls

paramdef.name: Depth
paramdef.usage: Number of directory levels to include, with -1 representing full depth

paramdef.name: MD5
paramdef.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA1

paramdef.name: SHA256
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: Analyze Entropy
paramdef.usage: Calculate entropy for executable files. High entropy may indicate a packed executable.

paramdef.name: Enumerate Imports
paramdef.usage: Identify modules and functions imported by executable files.

paramdef.name: Enumerate Exports
paramdef.usage: Identify modules and functions exported by executable files.

paramdef.name: Analyze File Anomalies

paramdef.name: Minimum Sizes

Enumerate the active files.
Active means non-deleted files.

paramdef.name: Deleted Files
paramdef.usage: Enumerate the deleted files.

paramdef.name: Parse NTFS INDX Buffers
paramdef.usage: Parse unused space in NTFS INDX buffers to find previous directory entries.

paramdef.name: Filter MD5
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific MD5 hash

paramdef.name: Filter SHA1
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA1 hash

paramdef.name: Filter SHA256
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA256 hash

paramdef.name: Content Regex
paramdef.usage: Search files for particular content.

paramdef.name: AND Operator
paramdef.usage: A file's content must match all regex parameters.

paramdef.name: Strings
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to parse specified files for strings. If strings is enabled, default string length is 4.

paramdef.name: shortest matched string
paramdef.usage: Minimum Recognized String Length. Default: 4

paramdef.name: Include Files
paramdef.usage: Return file item types.

paramdef.name: Include Directories
paramdef.usage: Return directory item types.

paramdef.name: Get Resources
paramdef.usage: Return resources stored in a PE file.

paramdef.name: Get Version Info
paramdef.usage: Return version information stored in a PE file.

paramdef.name: Get Resource Data
paramdef.usage: Return all data associated with all resources in a PE file. WARNING: This option can return very large amounts of data even with narrowly-scoped audits. Consider using "Exclude Resource Types" and verifying the size of the results from a single host before running on multiple hosts.

paramdef.name: Exclude Resource Types
paramdef.usage: List of resource types to exclude when extracting PE resources.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Acquire a File (Raw Mode)
moduledef.warning: Returns only the first match of a deleted file if INode is not specified.
moduledef.usage: Acquires and downloads a specific file using a method that may bypass security or access restrictions and retrieve deleted files

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage:
The absolute path of the directory containing the file to acquire.
Example:
D:\
C:\WINDOWS\

paramdef.name: Filename
paramdef.usage:
The name of the file to acquire.
Example: notepad.exe:malware.ads

paramdef.name: Inode
paramdef.usage:
The Inode of the file to return.
Note: if the inode is not specified
 and deleted is set to true,
 the first file encountered is returned.

paramdef.name: Deleted
paramdef.usage: Acquire deleted files.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Volume Listing
moduledef.usage: List volumes which may be mounted by physical disks.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Disk Listing
moduledef.usage: List of physical devices which may be acquired as a Disk Image

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage:
The global path of the symbolic link for the disk or volume to acquire. The trailing back-slash is optional.
Example: \\.\

paramdef.name: Filename
paramdef.usage:
The name of the file to acquire.
Example: PhysicalDrive0

paramdef.name: offset
paramdef.usage: Specifies the offset in bytes from the beginning of the disk.

paramdef.name: size
paramdef.usage: Specifies the size to acquire in bytes.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage:
Path where search starts. The trailing back-slash is optional.
Examples: 
C:\
D:\WINDOWS\

paramdef.title: Path Regex
paramdef.name: Regex
paramdef.usage:
Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a file must match to be returned.
You must use standard Regular Expression escaping ( '\\' matches a single '\', '\.' matches '.' )

Examples:
Match all files in any subdirectory: .*
Match .xls files in any subdirectory: .*\.xls
Match .xls files in a subdirectory named Temp: .*\\Temp\\.*\.xls

paramdef.name: Depth
paramdef.usage: Number of directory levels to include, with -1 representing full depth

paramdef.name: Minimum Sizes
paramdef.usage: The minimum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

paramdef.name: Maximum Sizes
paramdef.usage: The maximum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

paramdef.name: Active Files
paramdef.usage:
Enumerate the active files.
Active means non-deleted files.

paramdef.name: Deleted Files
paramdef.usage: Enumerate the deleted files.

paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific MD5 hash

paramdef.name: Filter SHA1
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA1 hash

paramdef.name: Filter SHA256
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA256 hash

paramdef.name: Content Regex
paramdef.usage: Search files for particular content.

paramdef.name: AND Operator
paramdef.usage: A file's content must match all regex parameters.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: Path
paramdef.usage:
Path where search starts. The trailing back-slash is optional.
Examples: 
C:\
D:\WINDOWS\

paramdef.title: Path Regex
paramdef.name: Regex
paramdef.usage:
Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a file must match to be returned.
You must use standard Regular Expression escaping ( '\\' matches a single '\', '\.' matches '.' )

Examples:
Match all files in any subdirectory: .*
Match .xls files in any subdirectory: .*\.xls
Match .xls files in a subdirectory named Temp: .*\\Temp\\.*\.xls

paramdef.name: Depth
paramdef.usage: Number of directory levels to include, with -1 representing full depth

paramdef.name: Minimum Sizes
paramdef.usage: The minimum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

paramdef.name: Maximum Sizes
paramdef.usage: The maximum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

paramdef.name: Filter MD5
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific MD5 hash

paramdef.name: Filter SHA1
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA1 hash

paramdef.name: Filter SHA256
paramdef.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA256 hash

paramdef.name: Content Regex
paramdef.usage: Search files for particular content.

paramdef.name: AND Operator
paramdef.usage: A file's content must match all regex parameters.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: offset
paramdef.usage: Specifies the offset in bytes from the beginning of physical memory. Note: This will be rounded to the lower page boundary.

paramdef.name: size
paramdef.usage: Specifies the size of memory to return. Note: This will be rounded to the next page boundary.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Process Listing (Memory)
moduledef.usage: Lists running processes with comprehensive information about imported modules, sections, and other data gathered from advanced memory scanning techniques.
moduledef.warning: May return more information than expected if run against all processes, specifying a PID is recommended.

paramdef.name: pid
paramdef.usage: Specifies the Process ID (PID) of the process to analyze.

paramdef.name: process name
paramdef.usage:
The first 15 characters of the process name. 
Cannot be specified in conjunction with PID.

paramdef.name: handles
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to parse the process handles.

paramdef.name: sections
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to parse the process memory sections.

paramdef.name: ports
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to parse the process for open ports.

paramdef.name: enumerate imports
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to enumerate imports of all loaded modules for a given process.

paramdef.name: enumerate exports
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to enumerate exports of all loaded modules for a given process.

paramdef.name: Content Regex
paramdef.usage: Only return processes with particular content.

paramdef.name: Preserve Times
paramdef.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

paramdef.name: MemD5
paramdef.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file from memory.

paramdef.name: MD5
paramdef.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA1
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA256
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: Verify Digital Signatures
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to verify if the loaded modules within the processes address space are digitally signed. This operation can not be performed on a memory image.

paramdef.name: raw mode
paramdef.usage: Open files for hashing in raw mode.

paramdef.name: detect injected dlls
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to detect injected dlls.

paramdef.name: strings
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to parse a specified process for strings. If strings is enabled, default string length is 4.

paramdef.name: shortest matched string
paramdef.usage: Minimum Recognized String Length. Default: 4

paramdef.name: memory file
paramdef.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: memory file
paramdef.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

paramdef.name: enumerate imports
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to enumerate imports of all loaded modules for a given driver.

paramdef.name: enumerate exports
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to enumerate exports of all loaded modules for a given driver.

paramdef.name: strings
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to parse a specified driver for strings.

paramdef.name: shortest matched string
paramdef.usage: Minimum Recognized String Length

paramdef.name: Preserve Times
paramdef.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

paramdef.name: MD5
paramdef.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA1
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA256
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: Verify Digital Signatures
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to verify if the loaded drivers are digitally signed. This operation can not be performed on a memory image.

paramdef.name: raw mode
paramdef.usage: Open files for hashing in raw mode.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: memory file
paramdef.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Hook Detection
moduledef.usage: Finds the presence of root kits using IRP, System Service Descriptor Table Hooks, and Interrupt Descriptor Table Hooks (IDT)
moduledef.warning: May find legitmate hooks such as those used by antivirus software.

paramdef.name: idt
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to verify certain entries in the IDT.

paramdef.name: ssdt_index
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to verify the System Service Descriptor Table.

paramdef.name: ssdt_inline
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to check System Service Descriptor Table's functions for modifications to their prologues.

paramdef.name: drivers
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to check the systems drivers for IRP hooks.

paramdef.name: memory file
paramdef.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

paramdef.name: Verify Digital Signatures
paramdef.usage: Boolean indicating whether or not to verify if the hooked and hooking modules are digitally signed. This operation can not be performed on a memory image.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Process Memory Acquire
moduledef.usage: Allows for the acquisition of memory space for a specified process.

paramdef.name: pid
paramdef.usage: Specifies the Process ID (PID) of the process to analyze.

paramdef.name: process name
paramdef.usage:
The first 15 characters of the process name. 
Cannot be specified in conjunction with PID.

paramdef.name: Content Regex
paramdef.usage: Only return processes with particular content.

paramdef.name: memory file
paramdef.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Driver Memory Acquire
moduledef.usage: Allows for the acquisition of a driver from live memory or from a memory image.

paramdef.name: driver name
paramdef.usage: The driver name to acquire.

paramdef.name: memory file
paramdef.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Web Historian URL History
moduledef.usage: Returns a history of URLs visited. The options "GetThumbnails" and "GetIndexedPageContent" are only available for Chrome and Chrome Frame browsers.

paramdef.name: TargetBrowser
paramdef.usage: The name of the supported browser whose history will be extracted (Firefox, Internet Explorer, Safari, or Chrome).

paramdef.name: PathToHistoryFiles
paramdef.usage: The path to a user profile directory, the base profile directory, or a single history file from supported browser types.

paramdef.name: GetThumbnails
paramdef.usage: Should the audit attempt to retrieve thumbnail images of websites visited

paramdef.name: GetIndexedPageContent
paramdef.usage: Should the audit attempt to retrieve indexed page content of websites visited

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Web Historian Cookie History
moduledef.usage: Returns a history of Cookies stored on the system

paramdef.name: TargetBrowser
paramdef.usage: The name of the supported browser whose history will be extracted (Firefox, Internet Explorer, Safari, or Chrome).

paramdef.name: PathToHistoryFiles
paramdef.usage: The path to a user profile directory, the base profile directory, or a single history file from supported browser types.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Web Historian File Download History
moduledef.usage: Returns a history of Files downloaded through a browser

paramdef.name: TargetBrowser
paramdef.usage: The name of the supported browser whose history will be extracted (Firefox, Internet Explorer, Safari, or Chrome).

paramdef.name: PathToHistoryFiles
paramdef.usage: The path to a user profile directory, the base profile directory, or a single history file from supported browser types.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Web Historian Form History
moduledef.usage: Returns a history of forms edited through a browser. Form history is not collected for internet explorer since it is not stored in an index.dat file; autocomplete/autofill/intelliforms are stored in registry and need to be extracted completely differently than other internet explorer history data.

paramdef.name: TargetBrowser
paramdef.usage: The name of the supported browser whose history will be extracted (Firefox, Internet Explorer, Safari, or Chrome).

paramdef.name: PathToHistoryFiles
paramdef.usage: The path to a user profile directory, the base profile directory, or a single history file from supported browser types.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Host Network ARP Table
moduledef.usage: Returns information about entries in the IPv4 and IPv6 Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) tables on a host. Each host maintains its own ARP table necessary for basic network traffic routing. Entries in the ARP table describe mappings from IP addresses to physical interface addresses.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Host Network DNS Cache table
moduledef.usage: Returns DNS records stored in the computer's in-memory DNS cache table, which is maintained by the DNS Client Services windows component (which must be running for the table to be resident). The DNS cache table stores various DNS records that describe recently visited website domains.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Host Network Routing Table
moduledef.usage: Displays the IPv4 and IPv6 routing tables which store information about how a network destination is routed on a given interface.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Prefetch
moduledef.usage: Get details of the prefetch files kept in %SystemRoot%\Prefetch.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: Persistence
moduledef.usage: Get details of the persistence locations.

paramdef.name: MD5
paramdef.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA1
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: SHA256
paramdef.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

paramdef.name: Preserve Times
paramdef.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

paramdef.name: Analyze Entropy
paramdef.usage: Calculate entropy for executable files. High entropy may indicate a packed executable.

paramdef.name: Enumerate Imports
paramdef.usage: Identify modules and functions imported by executable files.

paramdef.name: Enumerate Exports
paramdef.usage: Identify modules and functions exported by executable files.

paramdef.name: Analyze File Anomalies
paramdef.usage: Detect higher-order anomalies which may indicate malicious files.

paramdef.name: Scan Entry Point Distance
paramdef.usage: Specifies the number of bytes from the entry point to scan for jumps.

paramdef.name: Verify Digital Signatures
paramdef.usage: Verify the digital signature on executable files

paramdef.name: Get Resources
paramdef.usage: Return resources stored in a PE file.

paramdef.name: Get Version Info
paramdef.usage: Return version information stored in a PE file.

paramdef.title: lua_script
paramdef.name: lua_script
paramdef.usage: Base64 encoded lua script to execute

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

moduledef.title: System Restore
moduledef.usage: Get details associated with each restore point on the system.

paramdef.name: Filter Behavior
paramdef.usage: Specifies what parts of an item are returned when matched using a filter.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: expression
paramdef.usage: An XPath expression to be applied to each item in an XML Audit Data document. If the expression evaluates to true or a node-set, the item will be included, otherwise it will be omitted.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: expression
paramdef.usage: An XPath expression to be applied to each item in an XML Audit Data document. If the expression evaluates to true or a node-set, the item will be included, otherwise it will be omitted.

paramdef.name: type
paramdef.usage: The type of filter. Acceptable values: Standard.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: expression
paramdef.usage: A regular expression to be applied to each item in an XML Audit Data document. If the expression evaluates to true, the item will be included, otherwise it will be omitted.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

paramdef.name: expression
paramdef.usage: A regular expression to be applied to each item in an XML Audit Data document. If the expression evaluates to true, the item will be included, otherwise it will be omitted.

paramdef.name: type
paramdef.usage: The type of filter. Acceptable values: Inclusion, Standard.

paramdef.name: path
paramdef.usage: The path to the item being filtered. Used only with Inclusion filters.

paramdef.name: Prevent Hibernation
paramdef.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.
